description: Change of use of two ground floor retail (A1) units to betting office A2
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | 2. Any interval commerical plant and building services plant associated the commerical parts of the premises which is audible inside dwellings within the same building shall designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR25 (Leq 5 mins) 2300 -0700hrs (Bedrooms) and NR 30 (Leq 1 hour) 0700 hrs -2300 hrs (Living Rooms)  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers | 3. Details to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises (including extract ducting) will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR35 Leq  mins 2300 - 0700 hrs and NR 40 Leq (1hr) 0700 - 2300  measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details as approved shall be implemented and thereafter retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | Suitable and sufficient accoustic separation to at least that specified in the 1992 Edition of the Approved Document E of the Building Regulations 1991 shall be provided between the commercial part of the premises and dwellings.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of the adjacent occupiers. | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | Details of car parking provision and pedestrian access in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submited to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site.  Such provision to be brought into the first occupation of any part of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking and pedestrians within the site.
